db:abstract.db:para: Demonstrates how to read the meta-data of available sensors.

db:article.db:para: This example is divided into two parts:

db:listitem.db:para: A C++ plugin that provides QML alternatives for QSensorExplorer, QPropertyInfo and QSensorItem C++ classes.
A QML Application that uses the QML types to read the sensor meta-data and present it.

db:article.db:para: This example is built as an executable with C++ code that runs the QML, but it can also be launched directly using the qmlscene tool. You should build the top-level sensor_explorer project before trying to run this example or it will not be able to find its dependencies.
Above, the -I . parameter adds the current directory as a module import path to locate the Explorer QML module.

db:section.db:title: Sensor Explorer QML Import
db:section.db:para: The Sensor Explorer QML import defines the Explorer QML module, exporting QSensorExplorer, QPropertyInfo and QSensorItem C++ classes as QML types. The source code is available in the sensor_explorer/import subdirectory.

db:section.db:title: Sensor Explorer QML Application
db:section.db:para: To write a QML application that will use the QML types exposed by the Explorer module, following steps are needed:
You can retrieve a list of all available sensors using SensorExplorer.availableSensors:
The example uses the returned list as a model to populate a view of available sensors.
To retrieve the properties of a sensor, use SensorItem.properties:
The property list is used as a model for another view that displays the property names and values.
